doc:
Adele Lacy https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adele_Lacy 0 Adele Lacey (September 8, 1910 – July 3, 1953), also spelled Adele Lacy, was an American film actress whose films all appeared during the Great Depression. A product of the USA's Midwest, and a teenager during the Roaring Twenties era of the flapper when girls were 'encouraged' to rebel against convention, she struck out for Hollywood, California while still a teenager armed with some skills in acting, dancing and also some still photography credits, although not yet having completed her high school. At the peek of that Great Depression when the dreams of the Roaring Twenties were dashed, her beauty and talents were recognized for a brief few moments of her life and she would land some credited and un-credited film roles at that difficult time in USA history - a worthy feat in itself. However, in the competitive world of Hollywood where 'actors' outnumber 'roles', the underlining terrors of that Great Depression, combined with a coming downfall of the 1930s famed musical movies which demanded chorus-lines, she, like so many others at the time, never succeeded in making that 'big breakthrough' away from on-screen dancing as so very, very few others had also done. Yet those moments must have been precious. As was the case with so many others, her private life appears to have suffered from the difficulties encountered in trying to 'make it'; she was twice married, suffered the horror of having to abandon her teenage dream and altered her 'flapper inspired' career path, yet still making some further use of her past successes and skills developed in 1932-1936 a few years later during 1939-1946, and then finally dying way-to-young under the age of 40, and if you can believe some of the sources elsewhere on the internet, perhaps by her own hand. Adele_Lacey ( September_8_,_1910 – July_3_,_1953 ) , also spelled Adele_Lacy , was an_American_film_actress whose_films all appeared during the_Great_Depression . A_product of the_USA 's_Midwest , and a_teenager during the_Roaring_Twenties_era of the_flapper when girls were ' encouraged ' to_rebel against convention , she struck out for Hollywood , California_while still a_teenager armed with some_skills in acting_,_dancing_and also some_still_photography_credits , although not yet_having_completed her_high_school . At the_peek of that_Great_Depression when the_dreams of the_Roaring_Twenties were_dashed , her_beauty_and_talents were_recognized for a_brief_few_moments of her_life and she would_land some_credited_and_un-credited_film_roles at that_difficult_time in USA_history - a_worthy_feat in itself . However , in the_competitive_world of Hollywood where '_actors '_outnumber ' roles ' , the_underlining_terrors of that_Great_Depression , combined with a_coming_downfall of the_1930s_famed_musical_movies which demanded chorus-lines , she , like so_many_others at the_time , never succeeded in making that ' big_breakthrough ' away from on-screen_dancing as so_very , very_few_others had_also_done . Yet those_moments must_have_been precious . As was the_case with so_many_others , her_private_life appears_to_have_suffered from the_difficulties encountered in trying_to_'_make it ' ; she was_twice_married , suffered the_horror of having_to_abandon her_teenage_dream and altered her_'_flapper_inspired_'_career_path , yet_still_making some_further_use of her_past_successes_and_skills developed in 1932-1936 a_few_years later during 1939-1946 , and then finally_dying way-to-young under the_age of 40 , and if you can_believe some of the_sources elsewhere on the_internet , perhaps by her_own_hand .
